meanings.definition: To vote for more candidates than allowed in an election.
meanings.sent1: During the school election, Tim accidentally overvoted for two candidates instead of one.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overvote in the upcoming election to ensure a fair outcome.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's enthusiasm led her to overvote for all her favorite classmates, thinking it would help them win.
meanings.sent4: Overvoting in the student council election is like trying to fit too many puzzle pieces into one spot.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overvoting can lead to disqualification from the election.

meanings.definition: The act of casting more votes than permitted.
meanings.sent1: The election officials discovered an instance of overvoting in the ballot count.
meanings.sent2: Overvoting can invalidate the entire election results if not caught in time.
meanings.sent3: The overvoting mistake on the ballot made everyone chuckle at the counting table.
meanings.sent4: The concept of overvoting is like trying to pour too much water into a small cup.
meanings.sent5: The news of overvoting spread quickly throughout the town, causing concern among voters.

meanings.definition: The practice of marking a ballot with more choices than allowed.
meanings.sent1: The overvoting on the ballot was a clear violation of the election rules.
meanings.sent2: Overvoting can lead to legal consequences due to its impact on election integrity.
meanings.sent3: The overvoting incident on the ballot paper made the election committee shake their heads in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The act of overvoting is like trying to wear too many hats on one's head.
meanings.sent5: The image of overvoting on the ballot stuck in the minds of the election officials.
